events.name: GDG Cloud Stockholm & Looklet
events.description:
Hello Cloud Developers, it is time for our first meetup. This one is held at Looklet's offices. We still have room for one more speaker. If you'd like to share something around developing in Google Cloud, please contact us!

Agenda:

17.30 Mingle, drinks and pizza

18.00 Introduction GDG

18.05 Introduction Looklet CDO Cecilia Borg

18.15 Building Resilient Cloud Native Apps in GKE - Jerry Jalava / Google Developer Expert & Google Authorized Trainer 

18.45 Q&A

19.00 Looklet studio tour and drinks

21.00 Finish

How to get there:

Looklet Office, subway station Medborgarplatsen.Åsögatan 119, Enter the Stalands parking lot and walk across the yard, enter and walk up the long stair case. Go through the first steel door and ring the bell!Call <a>[masked]</a> if you get lost.
events.how_to_find_us: Åsögatan 119, Enter the Stalands parking lot and walk across the yard, enter and walk up the long stair case.  Go through the first steel door and ring the bell! Call +46707106283 if you get lost.

events.name: GDG Cloud Stockholm December Meetup
events.description:
Drinks: Yes 

Food: Yes

Agenda:
1) The new Firebase Firestore - Overview and first impressions (Peter Svensson) 

2) Apache Beam and Cloud Dataflow a 10,000ft View (Daniel Bergqvist, Google)

events.name: GDG Cloud Stockholm June 2018 Meetup
events.description:
When: 17.45 (Talks begin at 18:00)
Drinks: Yes
Food: Yes
Coming home on time: Nope, this is a full on night.

Agenda:

1) Martin Omander (Google) - Serverless Computing;
If you want to spend more time building your product and less time managing servers, you should consider serverless computing. In this talk we will consider common use cases and how they can be implemented quickly using serverless products from Google.

2) John Angelmo - Terraform and GCP; More eyes on your infrastructure and letting each team handle their own infrastructure.

3) Leonid Kuligin (Google) - Training your ML Model with Google Cloud Platform.
1. benefits you get with training your models with the Cloud, basic options to do that
2. main considerations when using a rent-a-VM option for model training. CPUs vs GPUs vs TPUs.
3. vertical vs. horizontal training scalability. distributed model training: data vs model parallelism.
4. managed services for model training offered by GCP

events.name: GDG Cloud Stockholm, Meetup October 2018
events.description:
Food: Yes
Drinks: Yes
Agenda:

1. Julien Bisconti (Discovery Networks) - Chaos Engineering with Service Mesh.
2. Jason Quek (Avalon) - ML and GDPR

(Meetup will open for registration 11/8)

events.name: Firebase Codelab Day
events.description:
We're going to be at Avalon Solutions for a whole day Firebase Codelab!
You just pick your favourite codelab from the ones available here;

https://codelabs.developers.google.com/?cat=Firebase

There will be introductions to Firebase features such as authentication, firebase, firestore, storage and more. The event is free but seats are limited.

There will be food and drinks.

Agenda:

1. Firebase overview + some do's and dont's (Peter Svensson, Wasder)
2. Using ML Kit to host custom ML models in Firebase to bring an extra oomph in your application. (Jason Quek, Avalon Solutions)
3. Free codelab work alone or in groups with as much help as we can give (if it's an area of expertise of the organizers)

events.name: Cloud Storage
events.description:
Where: Kvadrat, Kungsbroplan 3A
When: 18.00 (Talks begin at ..)
Food&Drinks: Yessir!

Agenda:

1. Google Cloud Spanner vs. CockroachDB and open floor for cloud storage discussions
- Peter Svensson, WASDER.

2. Why you should put your internal tools on the internet.
Embark Studios decided early to ditch the VPN and put all their internal tools on the internet, using Google Kubernetes Engine and Google Cloud IAP + Cloud Armor.

Johan explains why this makes the tools not only easier to use, but also safer
- Johan Mjönes, Technical Director, Embark Studios

events.name: GDG Cloud Meetup June 2019
events.description:
Time: 18.00 (Doors open at 17.30)
Date: 17/6
Food&Drink: Yes

Agenda:

1. Hengameh Rezaei, Google - what is Anthos.

Position: Customer Engineer (Cloud Architect)
Role description: I help customers answering their technical questions on GCP tools and enabling them to move to GCP. I also review the system architecture and give advice on it. In summary, I help customer to succeed with GCP.

2. Abdel sghiouar, Google - GKE OnPrem Deep Dive.

3. Jonas Vadebo, NetEnt - experience running GKE OnPrem.

4. Martin Omander, Google

Martin Omander works for Google in Mountain View, California. His job in the Developer Relations team is to help developers build better software, and improve Google’s Cloud Platform to make it even better for that purpose. In his spare time he manages to sneak in some game programming.

In this talk you will hear the story of how a chain of pet clinics started their journey from a legacy system to a container-based and serverless system on Google Cloud Run, the code they wrote, and the benefits they reaped. You will also learn how you can embark on that journey with your organization, and achieve safer deployments and lower cost if you already have.

5. Mingle+drinks

events.name: Introduction to Kubernetes Workshop
events.description:
This is an introductory workshop for developers or system administrators who want to get up to speed on this newfangled Kubernetes thing.

We'll be using Google Cloud Platform during the exercises, but most of the material is applicable to any Kubernetes environment.

Don't forget to bring your laptop!

Food or drinks are not included.

NOTE!! Attending this workshop does not give you entrance to the DevFest later the same day (unless you also have registered for that event))

upcoming.name: GCP Innovative Cloud Meetup
upcoming.description:
Join us to learn more about the cloud and GCP, how it can help you modernize your IT. If you are thinking about starting the cloud journey this is the right place to get started, if you are already working with GCP you should come to learn some new tips and tricks and meet other passionate people.

We provide food, drinks and good vibes.
The event will start with talks about GCP related topics (topics and speakers will be announced soon) then we will have plenty of time for open discussion and networking.

Agenda:
17:00 - 17:15 Reception
17:15 - 17:40 Talk 1
17:40 - 17:45 Break
17:45 - 18:10 Talk 2
18:10 - 19:00 Food, drinks, open discussion, networking
upcoming.how_to_find_us: After entering the building go straight then turn right like you want to go to the Chinese visa center. Take the elevators right next to the visa center to the 6th floor.

group_profile.intro: GDG Cloud Stockholm Meetup for all who are interested in Google Cloud.
